pageContext.claim: “Yet, in the face of MS-13 and its threat, Washington, Democrats voted against legislation to remove these criminal aliens. They voted against Kate's Law. And they voted in favor of sanctuary cities that protect criminals. And they voted in favor catch and release. OK?”
pageContext.analysis: The House passed Kate's Law with 24 Democratic votes. It did not pass the Senate, where it would need 60 votes to clear procedural hurdles. Catch and release is not a single law, although Trump often mischaracterizes it that way. Republicans and Democrats have both contributed to catch and release policies.
